The presenter warns against deleting parts of an AVCHD recording because AVCHD spreads crucial metadata across its folder structure (e.g., BDMV, CLIPINF) alongside .MTS clips. Deleting folders would break this needed information and complicate sharing and editing. This is in contrast to the other options which suggest that AVCHD places everything inside a single .MTS file or stores only audio tracks, neither of which accurately describes the format.
